title.value: New service provides tax prep assistance during COVID-19

markup.content: The City of Detroit Mayorâ€™s Office, United Way for Southeastern Michigan, Accounting Aid Society and Wayne Metropolitan Community Action Agency are pleased to offer 3 ways to get your taxes prepared for free through the IRS approved Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) Program.
VITA is a safe and reliable way for Accounting Aid Society or Wayne Metro to prepare your federal, state and city tax returns in-person or virtually, at no cost.
Please the through the option descriptions below, and complete the survey to schedule a free tax prep appointment with a VITA provider.
1. Virtual: From the convenience of your home

content.content: A certified tax intake specialist will call you and walk you through the process of submitting your documents online
We will complete your taxes and contact you directly to review before submitting to the IRS.

markup.content: 2. Drop Off: A combination of over the phone and limited contact

content.content: A certified tax intake specialist will call you to gather all of your information and confirm the documents needed to complete your taxes
The intake specialist will help you select a location and time to drop off your documents to a tax preparer at a later date
We will complete your taxes and contact you to return to the drop off location to review and pick up a copy of your return
We will then submit it to the IRS

markup.content: 3. In-Person: On-site services designed to maintain a safe and socially distanced environment.

content.content: Schedule an appointment to have your tax return prepared in-person, on-site. Please allow 1 hour for your appointment

markup.content: How did you hear about this service?

items.name: hear-about
items.labelText: Accounting Aid Society website / social media

markup.content: Make your tax prep appointment with Accounting Aid Society
Make your tax prep appointment with Wayne Metropolitan Community Action Agency
